Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a deep double-convex body and a long round-topped nozzle with a rounded end. Set into a bowl-like container with a flat rim, a flat circular base with a groove, and a flat shoulder decorated with a double concentric moulding. The vertical ring handle is mainly missing. The filling-hole is surrounded by a raised ring, and the shoulder of the lamp is decorated with groups of concentric semicircles and rows of beads.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q567)
